column2: As a Marketing Manager, you will be responsible to direct and oversee our Marketing department. Design and review the Marketing budget.         Build relationships with media and stakeholders through creative PR strategies.         Monitor all marketing campaigns and improve them when necessary.         Prioritize marketing projects and allocate resources accordingly. column2: Digital Marketing Strategy: Develop and execute digital marketing strategies aligned with the overall marketing objectives of the company. Identify target audiences, set campaign goals, and select appropriate digital marketing channels and tactics to reach and engage the target audience effectively.     Content Creation and Optimization: Create compelling and engaging content for digital marketing campaigns, including website copy, blog posts, social media updates, emails, and advertisements. Optimize content for search engines (SEO) and ensure consistency with the brand s tone and messaging.     Social Media Management: Manage and maintain social media accounts, including content planning, posting, and community management. Develop social media campaigns to increase brand awareness, drive engagement, and expand the company s social media presence.     Search Engine Marketing (SEM) and Pay-per-Click (PPC): Plan and execute SEM and PPC campaigns, including keyword research, ad copywriting, bid management, and performance tracking. Optimize campaigns to maximize conversions, improve click-through rates, and manage advertising budgets effectively.     Email Marketing: Develop and implement email marketing campaigns, including creating targeted email lists, designing email templates, and monitoring campaign performance. Optimize email campaigns for deliverability, open rates, click-through rates, and conversions.     Analytics and Reporting: Track, analyse, and report on key digital marketing metrics and campaign performance using tools such as Google Analytics or other analytics platforms. Identify trends, insights, and areas for improvement, and make data-driven recommendations to enhance campaign effectiveness.     Website Management: Collaborate with web developers or content management teams to update and optimize the company website. Ensure the website is user-friendly, visually appealing, and optimized for search engines and conversions.     Online Advertising: Plan and execute online advertising campaigns across various platforms, such as Google Ads, social media ads, or display networks. Monitor ad performance, adjust targeting and budgets, and optimize campaigns to maximize return on ad spend (ROAS).     Lead Generation and Conversion: Develop strategies to generate leads, nurture prospects, and convert them into customers. Implement lead generation tactics, such as landing pages, lead magnets, and email automation, to drive conversions and support sales efforts.     Industry and Market Research: Stay updated with industry trends, competitor activities, and emerging digital marketing technologies. Conduct market research and gather customer insights to identify opportunities for growth and innovation.                               Qualifications and Skills:              Bachelor s degree in Marketing, Business, Communications, or a related field (or equivalent experience).     Proven experience in digital marketing, preferably in a similar role.     Solid knowledge of digital marketing channels, tools, and best practices.     Proficiency in digital marketing platforms and tools, such as Google Analytics, Google Ads, social media management platforms, and email marketing software.     Strong analytical skills to track and measure campaign performance and derive actionable insights.     Excellent written and verbal communication skills.     Creative thinking and problem-solving abilities.     Familiarity with SEO, SEM, PPC, social media marketing, and email marketing. column2: A Digital Marketing Executive is a professional responsible for planning, implementing, and managing digital marketing campaigns and strategies to promote products, services, or brands online. This job description outlines the key responsibilities, qualifications, and skills required for a Digital Marketing Executive role.        Responsibilities            Digital Strategy:        Develop and execute comprehensive digital marketing strategies that align with business goals and objectives. This includes identifying target audiences, selecting appropriate digital channels, and setting performance metrics.        Content Creation:        Create engaging and relevant content for digital marketing campaigns, including website content, blog posts, social media updates, email marketing campaigns, and more.        Social Media Management:        Manage and grow social media profiles on platforms such as Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Instagram, and others. Create and schedule posts, engage with the audience, and analyze social media performance.        Email Marketing:        Plan and execute email marketing campaigns, including newsletter creation, segmentation, and performance analysis. Ensure compliance with email marketing regulations (e.g., GDPR, CAN-SPAM).        SEO (Search Engine Optimization):        Optimize website content and structure for search engines to improve organic search rankings. Perform keyword research and monitor SEO performance using tools like Google Analytics.        Paid Advertising:        Manage pay-per-click (PPC) advertising campaigns on platforms like Google Ads, Bing Ads, and social media advertising. Monitor ad spend, optimize ad copy, and analyze ROI.        Analytics and Reporting:        Track and analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) using analytics tools like Google Analytics. Generate reports and provide insights to improve campaign effectiveness.        Website Management:        Collaborate with web developers to ensure the website is user-friendly, mobile-responsive, and optimized for conversions. Implement and test website changes as needed.        Digital Marketing Tools:        Utilize digital marketing tools and platforms such as email marketing software, social media management tools, marketing automation platforms, and more.        Budget Management:        Manage digital marketing budgets effectively, ensuring cost-efficiency and ROI optimization.        Qualifications          Educational Background:        Bachelors degree in Marketing, Digital Marketing, Business, or a related field. Relevant certifications (e.g., Google Ads, HubSpot) are a plus.        Digital Marketing Experience:        Prior experience in digital marketing, including managing campaigns across various digital channels.        Content Creation:        Strong writing and content creation skills for web, social media, and email marketing.        Analytical Skills:        Proficiency in data analysis and interpretation, using tools like Google Analytics or similar platforms.        SEO Knowledge:        Understanding of SEO principles and best practices.        Tech Savvy:        Familiarity with digital marketing tools, software, and platforms.        Creativity:        Ability to brainstorm and create innovative marketing campaigns and content.        Communication:        Excellent written and verbal communication skills.        Project Management:        Organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.        Adaptability:        Willingness to stay updated with digital marketing trends and adapt to evolving technologies.
column11: digital marketing, email marketing, search engines, seo tools, data analysis, content creation, marketing automation, search engine optimization, media management, writing, google analytics, seo, performance analysis, budget management, communication skills

column2: Role & responsibilities   Social Media Strategy: Plan and implement social media strategies to increase brand awareness, engagement, and drive traffic to the company's website or other platforms. This involves understanding the target audience, industry trends, and competitor analysis   Content Creation: Develop engaging content for various social media platforms such as Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, LinkedIn, TikTok, etc. This includes writing captions, creating visuals, and producing videos that resonate with the target audience.   Community Management: Monitor and engage with the audience on social media platforms by responding to comments, messages, and mentions. Build and nurture relationships with followers to enhance brand loyalty and advocacy.   Campaign Management: Coordinate and execute social media campaigns, including advertising campaigns on platforms like Facebook Ads, Instagram Ads, etc. Monitor campaign performance, adjust targeting and budget as necessary, and ensure campaigns meet objectives.   Analytics and Reporting: Track and analyze social media metrics such as reach, engagement, and conversions. Use analytics tools to generate reports and insights, and use this data to optimize future strategies and campaigns.   Stay Updated with Trends: Keep abreast of the latest social media trends, algorithm changes, and best practices. Experiment with new features and formats to keep the brand's social media presence fresh and relevant.   Collaboration: Collaborate with other departments such as marketing, sales, and customer service to align social media efforts with overall business goals and objectives. Work closely with graphic designers, copywriters, and other team members to ensure cohesive messaging and branding across all platforms. Crisis Management: Handle any potential social media crises swiftly and effectively, including negative comments, customer complaints, or PR issues. Develop strategies to mitigate damage to the brand's reputation and maintain a positive online presence. Brand Advocacy: Identify and cultivate relationships with brand advocates and influencers who can help amplify the brand's message and reach a wider audience. Experimentation and Innovation: Continuously test new ideas, formats, and strategies to improve social media performance and stay ahead of the competition. Be willing to adapt and innovate in response to changes in the social media landscape. Preferred candidate profile   Experience: 2-5 years in Developing and executing social media strategies, managing social media campaigns, and analyzing performance metrics    Education: A bachelor's degree in marketing, communications, advertising, or a related field is often preferred. Candidates with additional certifications or coursework in digital marketing or social media management. Perks and benefits

column2: Who is successful at BPM:               Caring people who put others first              Self-starters who embody the BPM entrepreneurial spirit              Authentic individuals with a diverse point of view              Lifelong learners with a drive to excel              Resilient people who rise to the occasion        Key Responsibilities:          Website Management               1.    Lead Website Development and Optimization:       Take charge of the continuous development and optimization of the BPM LLP website, ensuring it stays current with industry trends, adheres to best practices, and meets high standards for user experience.     Proactively research and implement innovative solutions to enhance website functionality and user engagement, keeping abreast of emerging technologies and design trends.           2.    Regular Audits and Optimization:       Conduct regular audits of the website to evaluate performance, usability, and SEO effectiveness, utilizing tools such as Google Analytics, Google Search Console, Core Web Vitals and SEMrush.     Analyze audit findings and user feedback to identify areas for improvement, such as page load speed, navigation structure, and content relevance, and implement necessary changes to optimize performance and user experience.           3.    Analytics and Insights:       Monitor website analytics metrics, including traffic sources, page views, bounce rates, and conversion rates, to track performance trends and identify opportunities for optimization.     Generate actionable insights from data analysis to inform strategic decision-making and drive continuous improvement initiatives across the website.           4.    Vendor Management:       Act as the primary liaison with the website vendor, managing the relationship and ensuring clear communication, timely project delivery, and adherence to budgetary constraints.     Collaborate with the vendor to address technical issues, implement updates, and coordinate major website initiatives, maintaining a positive and productive partnership.               HubSpot Administration                 1   . Campaign Management:         Execute and manage multi-channel marketing campaigns within HubSpot, including email marketing, paid advertising, and content marketing initiatives.             2.    Email Marketing:         Create, send, and track email marketing campaigns, including automated workflows and personalized email sequences.     Design and customize email templates to maintain brand consistency and streamline campaign creation.     Track email performance metrics such as open rates, click-through rates, and conversions to measure campaign effectiveness.             3.    Automation and Workflows:         Utilize HubSpots automation features to streamline marketing processes, automate repetitive tasks, and nurture leads through targeted workflows based on user behavior and engagement.     Design and implement lead nurturing workflows, drip campaigns, and automated follow-up sequences to guide prospects through the buyers journey and facilitate conversion.             4.    Performance Tracking and Optimization:         Monitor campaign performance metrics, including open rates, click-through rates, conversion rates, and ROI, using HubSpots reporting and analytics tools.     Conduct A/B testing and experimentation to optimize campaign elements, such as subject lines, content variations, CTAs, and timing, to maximize engagement and results.             5.    Lead Generation and Conversion:         Create and optimize landing pages, forms, and CTAs within HubSpot to capture leads, track conversions, and facilitate seamless integration with Salesforce.     Implement lead scoring and segmentation strategies to prioritize and qualify leads, ensuring alignment with sales objectives and efficient follow-up by the sales team.       Qualifications:         Bachelors degree in marketing, communications, or related field.      5+ years of experience in digital marketing, with a focus on website management and marketing operations.     5+ years of WordPress experience. Proficiency in website development languages (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) is preferred.      5+ years hands-on HubSpot experience.     3+ years vendor management experience.     Strong analytical skills, with the ability to gather and interpret data to inform decision-making and optimization strategies.     Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams.     Detail-oriented with a commitment to quality and accuracy in all tasks and deliverables.     Proven ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.     Understanding of ADA website compliance standards and best practices.     Knowledge of project management principles is a plus.

column2: Job Description: We're in search of a highly skilled Digital Marketing Specialist to join our team. As an expert in digital marketing, you'll be tasked with crafting and executing comprehensive strategies across all digital marketing avenues. The ideal candidate should have a profound understanding of various digital marketing channels and techniques, coupled with a proven history of successful campaigns. This role necessitates strong analytical skills, creativity, and the ability to stay abreast of the latest trends in digital marketing. Responsibilities: Develop and implement digital marketing strategies aligned with company goals. Manage digital marketing campaigns across SEM, SEO, social media, email, content, and display advertising. Conduct thorough market research to identify target audiences, trends, and competitor strategies. Optimize website content and landing pages for improved search rankings and traffic. Monitor and analyze KPIs to measure campaign effectiveness and make data-driven decisions. Collaborate with design, content, and development teams to create engaging digital assets. Stay updated on industry trends and emerging technologies. Utilize marketing automation tools to streamline processes and enhance campaign efficiency. Identify and leverage partnerships with influencers and industry leaders to boost brand visibility. Manage paid digital advertising campaigns, including budget allocation and performance tracking. Proficiency in digital marketing tools like Google Analytics, AdWords, and social media management platforms. Proven experience in developing and executing successful digital marketing campaigns. Strong analytical skills for interpreting complex data and deriving insights. Excellent written and verbal communication skills for effective presentation of ideas and strategies. Creative thinking to devise innovative marketing solutions. Strong project management skills to meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment. Relevant digital marketing certifications are a plus.

column2: ROLE OVERVIEW The successful candidate will have the capacity to thrive in a fast-paced environment, while managing a wide variety of projects, communications, and content. The ideal candidate will possess an excellent command of English language (strong in both written and verbal communication skills, including grammar), strong project management and coordination skills, and the ability to handle dynamic tasks in a time-sensitive environment. The candidate will provide ideation and content creation for communications (including email marketing, social media, presentations, printed materials and collateral), as well as website and manage content across IC3 platforms. S/he will exhibit a professional attitude, with superior organizational and time management skills. The candidate will have the ability to complete tasks within a deadline. MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES  Content writing, creative marketing, strategy and implementation for a variety of communication material and collaterals: emailers, websites, presentations, brochures, reports, and other communication with a focus on digital  Create, schedule and manage social media handles with reporting of analytics (design expertise for social posts is not mandatory). Proficient with LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, WhatsApp and Twitter social media platforms  Create, coordinate, organize, prepare communications material and follow-up for a variety of projects surrounding the development, preparation, and execution of IC3  Plan, execute, and optimize digital marketing campaigns to drive traffic, leads, and conversions. Should have experience in a mix of paid advertising (LinkedIn, Facebook & Instagram) and?email marketing to achieve campaign objectives. (Mandatory skill)   Monitor and analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) for digital channels, including website traffic, social media engagement, email open rates, and conversion rates.    Movement initiatives including sessions, workshops, speakers/presenters and programs, with deep attention to detail  Coordinate and maintain engagement with global volunteer committees  Understanding of IC3 mission and platforms  Administrative and other related duties as assigned QUALIFICATIONS EDUCATION: Bachelor's degree or equivalent. Candidates with a background in English (or similar with very strong writing components), and digital communications experience preferred. WORK EXPERIENCE: Three to four years prior experience in creative writing and/or marketing communications and digital marketing. SKILLS: The candidate should excel in creative communications, organization, content writing and management, and problem-solving.  Excellent writing and communication skills  Extremely detail-oriented  Proficient with social media platforms  Proficient with email marketing tools  Ability to plan in advance, multitask and work in a fast-paced environment  Effective time management skills: ability to manage multiple projects and work with tight deadlines  Understanding of digital communication is preferred  Driven, self-starter  Polished and professional demeanor with great flexibility and openness to feedback  Proficient at Microsoft Office programs, the Google Suite, experience preferred in additional social media scheduling and analytics tools, and other relevant software  The ability to work independently and as part of a team ADDITIONAL INFORMATION IMPACT & INFLUENCE: This position will interact on a consistent basis with higher education leadership, high school counseling professionals/school leaders and teachers, college and university officials, and partner organizations/sponsors. column2: SEO Specialist, Google Ads, and Facebook Ads Specialist (must have supported US Clients) Position Overview: We are a dynamic marketing company seeking a talented individual to join our team as an SEO Specialist, Google Ads, and Facebook Ads Specialist with a primary focus on client support. In this role, you will work closely with our US based clients to understand their goals, provide strategic guidance, and execute effective SEO, Google Ads, and Facebook Ads campaigns to drive results. Responsibilities: 1. Act as the primary point of contact for assigned clients, building and maintaining strong relationships through regular communication and proactive support. 2. Collaborate with clients to understand their business objectives, target audience, and key performance indicators (KPIs) to develop tailored digital marketing strategies. 3. Conduct comprehensive SEO audits and analysis for clients' websites, providing actionable recommendations to improve organic search visibility and traffic. 4. Develop and execute custom SEO strategies, including keyword research, on-page optimization, and link building, to achieve clients' goals and objectives . 5. Create and manage Google Ads campaigns for clients, including keyword research, ad copywriting, bid management, and performance monitoring. 6. Develop and implement Facebook Ads campaigns targeting specific audiences, with a focus on driving engagement, conversions, and ROI for clients. 7. Monitor campaign performance metrics, analyze data, and provide regular reporting and insights to clients, highlighting successes, areas for improvement, and optimization opportunities. 8. Proactively identify opportunities to upsell additional services or suggest strategic changes to clients' marketing strategies based on performance analysis and industry trends. 9. Stay up-to-date with industry developments, algorithm changes, and best practices in SEO, Google Ads, and Facebook Ads to continuously improve campaign effectiveness and client satisfaction. 10. Work collaboratively with internal teams, including account management, design, and content, to ensure seamless execution of client campaigns and alignment with overall marketing objectives. Qualifications: 1. Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Communications, or any other field. 2. Proven experience in digital marketing, with a focus on SEO, Google Ads, and Facebook Ads campaign management .3. Strong client-facing experience, with the ability to build and maintain relationships, understand client needs, and provide strategic guidance. 4. Excellent analytical skills, with the ability to interpret data, analyze campaign performance, and provide actionable insights and recommendations. 5. Proficiency in tools such as Google Analytics, Google Ads, Facebook Ads Manager, and SEO auditing software. 6. Exceptional communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex ideas and data to clients in a clear and concise manner. 7. Highly organized with strong project management skills, able to prioritize tasks, manage multiple clients, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment. 8. Certifications in Google Ads and Facebook Blueprint are a plus. 9. Passion for digital marketing and a proactive attitude towards learning and staying up-to-date with industry trends and best practices. Join our team and be part of a collaborative and supportive environment where your contributions are valued, and your skills are continually developed. If you thrive in a client-focused role and have a passion for driving results through digital marketing, we encourage you to apply. Role & responsibilities   Preferred candidate profile   Perks and benefits

column2: Role & responsibilities     Conceptualization : Generating ideas and conceptualizing designs based on client briefs or project requirements. Visual Identity Development : Creating visual identities, including logos, brand guidelines, and style guides to ensure consistency across all brand materials. Graphic Design : Designing various types of graphics such as illustrations, infographics, icons, and other visual elements for print and digital media. Layout Design : Designing layouts for publications, brochures, posters, advertisements, and other marketing materials. Typography : Selecting appropriate fonts and arranging text in an aesthetically pleasing and legible manner. Image Editing : Editing and retouching images to enhance their quality and suitability for specific purposes. Digital Design : Designing user interfaces (UI) and user experience (UX) elements for websites, mobile apps, and other digital platforms. Print Production : Preparing designs for print production, including setting up files according to printing specifications and collaborating with printers to ensure quality output. Software Proficiency : Proficiency in graphic design software such as Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, and other relevant tools. Client Communication : Collaborating with clients, understanding their needs, presenting design concepts, and incorporating feedback into final designs. Project Management : Managing multiple projects simultaneously, prioritizing tasks, and meeting deadlines effectively. Stay Updated : Keeping up-to-date with industry trends, emerging technologies, and design best practices. Team Collaboration : Collaborating with other members of the creative team, including copywriters, marketers, and web developers, to ensure cohesive and integrated design solutions. Feedback Incorporation : Receiving feedback from clients, team members, or stakeholders, and making necessary revisions to designs. Quality Assurance : Ensuring the quality, accuracy, and consistency of design deliverables before final delivery. Preferred candidate profile Graduate with knowledge of Designing software like Corel Draw, Illustrator etc... Perks and benefits   Best in the Industry.

column2: A Digital Marketing Specialist is responsible for planning, executing, and managing various digital marketing strategies and campaigns to enhance brand visibility, drive website traffic, and generate leads or sales. This role involves utilizing a range of digital channels and platforms to connect with target audiences, build engagement, and achieve business goals.         Key Responsibilities:         Strategy Development:   Collaborate with the marketing team to develop comprehensive digital marketing strategies aligned with overall business objectives.   Identify target audiences, personas, and segmentations to tailor campaigns effectively.         Content Management:         Create and curate compelling and relevant content across various digital channels, including social media, websites, blogs, emails, and more.   Ensure content aligns with brand guidelines, messaging, and SEO best practices.     Social Media Management:         Plan, schedule, and manage social media campaigns across platforms like Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, LinkedIn, etc.   Engage with followers, respond to comments, and monitor trends to optimize social media presence.       Search Engine Optimization (SEO):       Optimize website content for search engines to improve organic search visibility and rankings.   Conduct keyword research, analyze website performance, and implement SEO strategies.       Pay-Per-Click (PPC) Advertising:       Create, manage, and optimize paid advertising campaigns on platforms like Google Ads, Bing Ads, and social media advertising.   Monitor ad performance, analyze data, and make adjustments to improve ROI.       Email Marketing:       Develop email marketing campaigns, including creating compelling content, designing templates, and managing email lists.   Track open rates, click-through rates, and conversion rates to refine email strategies.         Analytics and Reporting:       Monitor and analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) such as website traffic, engagement, conversion rates, and ROI.   Create regular reports to showcase campaign performance and provide actionable insights.         Digital Marketing Tools:         Utilize various digital marketing tools such as Google Analytics, social media management platforms, email marketing software, and SEO tools.         Continuous Learning:       Stay updated with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in digital marketing.   Experiment with new strategies and techniques to optimize campaign performance.       Qualifications and Skills:         Bachelors degree in Marketing, Business, Communications, or a related field.         Proven experience in digital marketing, with a strong track record of successful campaigns.         In-depth knowledge of various digital marketing channels, platforms, and techniques.         Proficiency in using digital marketing tools and software.         Strong analytical skills and ability to interpret data to make informed decisions.         Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.         Creative thinking and problem-solving skills.         Ability to work independently and as part of a team.         Time management and project management skills.

column2: Role & responsibilities     1.  Digital Strategy Development:  - Collaborate with the marketing team to develop digital marketing strategies aligned with overall business objectives and target audience demographics. - Conduct market research and competitive analysis to identify digital marketing opportunities and trends. - Define key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the success of digital marketing initiatives. 2.  Campaign Planning and Execution:  - Plan, execute, and optimize digital marketing campaigns across multiple channels, including social media, email, search engine marketing (SEM), display advertising, and content marketing. - Create engaging and persuasive content for digital assets, such as websites, social media posts, email newsletters, and digital ads. - Manage the scheduling, budgeting, and tracking of digital marketing campaigns to ensure they meet performance targets and deadlines. 3.  Search Engine Optimization (SEO) and Search Engine Marketing (SEM):  - Conduct keyword research and analysis to optimize website content for search engines and improve organic search rankings. - Manage pay-per-click (PPC) advertising campaigns on platforms such as Google Ads and Bing Ads to drive targeted traffic and conversions. - Monitor and analyze campaign performance metrics, such as click-through rates (CTR), conversion rates, and return on ad spend (ROAS), to identify optimization opportunities. 4.  Social Media Management:  - Develop and implement social media marketing strategies to build brand awareness, engage followers, and drive website traffic. - Create and curate content for social media platforms, including Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Instagram, and YouTube. - Monitor social media channels for mentions, comments, and messages, and respond promptly to customer inquiries or feedback. 5.  Email Marketing and Automation:  - Plan and execute email marketing campaigns to nurture leads, promote products or services, and drive conversions. - Segment email lists based on user demographics, behavior, and engagement metrics to deliver targeted and personalized content. - Implement email marketing automation workflows to streamline communication and lead nurturing processes. 6.  Analytics and Reporting:  - Monitor and analyze digital marketing performance metrics using web analytics tools such as Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, or similar platforms. - Generate regular reports and dashboards to communicate campaign results, insights, and recommendations to stakeholders. - Use data-driven insights to optimize digital marketing strategies and tactics for improved performance and ROI. Qualifications:  - Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Digital Marketing, Communications, or a related field (Master's degree preferred). Preferred candidate profile   - Experience in digital marketing, with a focus on campaign planning, execution, and optimization. - Strong understanding of digital marketing channels, platforms, and best practices. - Proficiency in digital marketing tools and platforms, including Google Analytics, Google Ads, Facebook Ads Manager, email marketing software (e.g., Mailchimp, Constant Contact), and social media management tools (e.g., Hootsuite, Buffer). - Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to create compelling content for digital channels. - Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret data, draw insights, and make data-driven decisions. - Creative thinking and problem-solving skills, with a passion for staying updated on industry trends and innovations in digital marketing. Perks and benefits

column2: Job Description: We are looking for an experienced and talented individual to join our team as a Digital Marketer with a focus on content creation. The ideal candidate should have a strong understanding of the US healthcare industry and its marketing strategies, along with a proven track record of successfully working with international clients, particularly in the US market. The role requires expertise in generating leads, crafting compelling content, and implementing effective social media optimization (SMO) strategies, with a primary focus on LinkedIn. This position is not for beginners; we are seeking seasoned professionals with a demonstrated history of achieving results for international clients.   Important Notice: Freshers who have passed in 2022, 2023, and 2024 are most welcome and eligible to apply. No Work From Home Do NOT apply to this job if you have NOT read the entire description, roles, and responsibilities. Read it thoroughly and then apply for it. Role & responsibilities Content Creation: Produce high-quality, engaging, and SEO-optimized content for various marketing channels, including websites, blogs, and social media. Ensure content aligns with the US healthcare industry's nuances and resonates with the target audience. Lead Generation: Develop and execute strategies to generate leads, increase brand awareness, and drive business growth. Leverage digital platforms, with a particular focus on LinkedIn, to connect with potential leads. Social Media Optimization (SMO): Implement effective SMO strategies, with a primary emphasis on LinkedIn, to maximize reach and engagement. Utilize social media analytics to measure and enhance the impact of content. Keyword Research and SEO: Conduct thorough keyword research to enhance content visibility and improve search engine rankings. Implement on-page and off-page SEO strategies to optimize content for search engines. Knowledge of Marketing Systems and Software: Have a sound understanding of marketing tools, systems, and software used for day-to-day marketing activities. Stay updated on emerging trends and tools within the digital marketing landscape. Client Interaction: Work closely with international clients, particularly US-based, to understand their needs and align content strategies with business goals. Provide regular updates and reports to clients, demonstrating the impact of marketing efforts. Proven Record with International Clients: Showcase a proven track record of working with international clients, especially in the US market, and delivering measurable results. Office Attendance: This position requires in-office attendance; no work-from-home option is available.

column2: We are seeking a highly motivated and skilled Search Engine Optimization (SEO) Specialist to join our dynamic digital marketing team at Gururo. As an SEO Specialist, you will play a crucial role in driving organic traffic, increasing search engine rankings, and enhancing our online presence across various search engines. This is a full-time, remote work-from-home position, allowing you to work flexibly from the comfort of your own space.       Responsibilities:         Perform thorough keyword research to identify relevant and high-traffic keywords that align with our business goals.         Develop and implement effective SEO strategies to increase organic traffic, visibility, and search engine rankings.         Conduct on-page optimization, including optimizing meta tags, headings, content, and internal linking structures to improve search engine crawlability and indexation.         Optimize website performance for speed, mobile responsiveness, and user experience to enhance overall search visibility.         Identify and address technical SEO issues, such as broken links, crawl errors, and duplicate content.         Collaborate with content creators to ensure SEO best practices are integrated into the content creation process.         Stay up-to-date with industry trends, search engine algorithms, and best practices to continuously improve SEO strategies.         Monitor and analyze website analytics, search console data, and other relevant SEO tools to measure the effectiveness of SEO efforts and make data-driven decisions.         Generate regular SEO performance reports and provide insights and recommendations to improve performance and achieve KPIs.         Assist in identifying and pursuing link-building opportunities to improve domain authority and increase backlinks from reputable sources.         Stay informed about competitor SEO strategies and recommend action plans to maintain a competitive edge.         Collaborate with other digital marketing team members on cross-functional projects and initiatives.         Requirements:         Proven experience as an SEO Specialist or similar role, with a track record of successful SEO campaigns and improved search rankings.         In-depth knowledge of search engine algorithms, ranking factors, and SEO best practices.         Proficiency in using SEO tools such as Google Analytics, Google Search Console, Ahrefs, SEMrush, Moz, etc.         Solid understanding of HTML, CSS, and website architecture as they relate to SEO.         Familiarity with content management systems (e.g., WordPress) and website platforms.         Strong analytical skills and the ability to interpret data and generate actionable insights.         Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, to effectively collaborate with team members and stakeholders.         Self-motivated, detail-oriented, and able to work independently while meeting deadlines.         Creative problem-solving skills to overcome challenges and improve SEO performance.         A proactive approach to staying updated with industry trends and changes in search engine algorithms.         Preferred Qualifications:         Bachelors degree in Marketing, Business, Computer Science, or a related field.         Experience in e-commerce SEO and familiarity with marketplace platforms          Knowledge of international SEO and optimizing websites for global audiences.

As we continue to grow and expand our presence in the digital landscape, we are seeking a talented Digital Marketing Executive to join our team. This role will involve managing social media accounts, creating engaging content, optimizing online advertising campaigns, and analyzing performance metrics to drive results. column2: We are seeking an experienced Digital Marketing Executive to join our team. As a Digital Marketing Executive, you will be responsible for developing and implementing digital marketing strategies to drive online presence, increase brand awareness, and generate leads. You should have a strong understanding of various digital marketing channels, including SEO, SEM, social media, email marketing, and content marketing. This position requires a creative and analytical mindset, excellent communication skills, and the ability to stay updated with the latest digital marketing trends and best practices.             Responsibilities:         Develop and execute digital marketing strategies to achieve business goals, including lead generation, customer acquisition, and brand awareness.     Conduct market research to identify target audiences, customer preferences, and industry trends to optimize marketing campaigns.     Manage and optimize digital marketing channels, including SEO, SEM (Google Ads, Bing Ads), social media (Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Instagram), email marketing, and content marketing.     Monitor and analyze campaign performance using digital marketing tools and analytics platforms, such as Google Analytics, to track key metrics, measure ROI, and identify areas for improvement.     Plan and execute SEO strategies to improve organic search rankings, increase website traffic, and enhance user experience.     Create and manage paid advertising campaigns on various platforms, including Google Ads, Bing Ads, and social media advertising, to drive targeted traffic and conversions.     Develop engaging and high-quality content for various digital channels, including website, blog, social media, and email newsletters, to attract and engage the target audience.     Collaborate with internal teams, including designers, content writers, and developers, to ensure consistent brand messaging and optimize user experience across all digital touch points.     Monitor and manage online reputation, including reviews, ratings, and customer feedback, and implement strategies to enhance brand perception.     Stay updated with the latest digital marketing trends, technologies, and industry best practices, and recommend innovative strategies to enhance overall digital marketing performance.         Qualifications:         Bachelor s degree in marketing, communications, or a related field.     Proven experience as a Digital Marketing Executive or similar role, with 3-5 years of hands-on experience in implementing digital marketing strategies.     In-depth knowledge of digital marketing channels, including SEO, SEM, social media, email marketing, content marketing, and analytics.     Proficiency in digital marketing tools and platforms, such as Google Analytics, Google Ads, social media management tools (e.g., Hootsuite, Sprout Social), and email marketing platforms (e.g., MailChimp, HubSpot).     Strong understanding of SEO principles, keyword research, on-page and off-page optimization techniques, and SEO tools.     Experience in managing paid advertising campaigns on Google Ads, Bing Ads, and social media platforms.     Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to create compelling content and effectively communicate digital marketing strategies to stakeholders.     Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret data, track KPIs, and make data-driven decisions to optimize campaigns.     Creative thinking and problem-solving skills to develop innovative digital marketing strategies.     Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously while meeting deadlines.         Note   : The above job description serves as a general guideline for the responsibilities and qualifications of a Digital Marketing Executive with 3-5 years of experience. Actual job descriptions may vary depending on the specific requirements and expectations of the hiring company.

column2: The digital marketing executive is a key player responsible for planning, executing, and optimising digital marketing efforts to meet the companys objectives. They must have a strong educational background, relevant experience, and a wide range of skills in digital marketing, analytics, and technology evaluation to excel in this role.         Job Description:         Campaign Management:    digital marketing executive is responsible for planning and executing various digital marketing campaigns. This includes campaigns on the web, SEO/SEM, marketing databases, email, social media, and display advertising.       Social Media Management:    They are also in charge of building and maintaining the companys presence on social media platforms.       Performance Measurement:    The executive tracks and reports on the performance of all digital marketing campaigns. They evaluate the success of these campaigns based on predefined goals, such as return on investment (ROI) and key performance indicators (KPIs).       Data Analysis:   The exurtive analyses data to identify trends and insights. This information is then used to optimise marketing spending and campaign performance.       Strategy Development:   They brainstorm new and creative strategies for growing the companys digital presence and achieving marketing goals.       Experimentation:   The excutive plans, executes, and measures experiments and tests to improve conversion rates and campaign effectiveness.       Collaboration:   They work closely with internal teams to create effective landing pages and enhance the overall user experience.       Analytics and funnel optimisation:   The excutive uses strong analytical skills to evaluate the entire customer journey across different marketing channels. They identify points where customers either convert or drop off and make improvements accordingly.       Vendor Partnerships:   The excutive collaborates with external agencies and other vendor partners to support the companys marketing efforts.       Technology Evaluation:   They stay updated on emerging technologies and evaluate their potential benefits for the companys marketing strategies.       Thought Leadership:   The Digital Marketing Executive provides valuable insights and leadership in adopting new technologies and strategies when they are suitable for the companys goals.         Educational Background and Experience Requirements:           Education:   The candidate should have a bachelors or masters degree in marketing or a related field. This educational background provides the foundational knowledge required for this role.       Work Experience:   The candidate must have prior working experience in the field of digital marketing, particularly within the industry relevant to the companys operations. This experience demonstrates the candidates familiarity with digital marketing practises specific to the industry.       Campaign Management:   The candidate should have demonstrable experience in leading and managing various digital marketing campaigns. This includes campaigns related to search engine optimisation (SEO) and search engine marketing (SEM), managing marketing databases, email marketing, social media marketing, and display advertising.       Landing Page Optimisation:   The candidate should have experience optimising landing pages. This involves making webpages more effective at converting visitors into customers or leads.       Experimentation Skills:   The candidate should have experience with A/B and multivariate experiments. These are techniques used to test different variations of marketing content or strategies to see which performs better.       Analytics Knowledge:   The candidate should possess solid knowledge of various website and marketing analytics tools such as Google Analytics, NetInsight, Omniture, WebTrends, and SEMRush. These tools are essential for tracking and analysing the performance of digital marketing efforts.       Advertising Expertise:   The candidate should have working knowledge of ad-serving tools and be an expert in Facebook advertising. This includes understanding how to create and optimise advertisements on the Facebook platform.       PPC Campaign Experience:   The candidate should have experience in setting up and optimising pay-per-click (PPC) advertising campaigns on major search engines like Google and Bing.       Technical Skills:   The candidate should have a working knowledge of web development languages such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. This knowledge is useful for understanding and working within the technical constraints of digital marketing.

column2: Brief We are looking for an experienced and result-driven Digital Marketing Executive to join our marketing team!  As a Digital Marketing Executive at our company, you will be solely responsible for setting up, implement and managing the company's digital marketing strategy.  We are expecting you to have experience and a big passion for digital marketing technologies and a keen interest in trends. Job Description Develop a digital marketing strategy & program for company & products. Plan and execute all web, SEO/SEM, database marketing, email, social media plans. Develop a prioritized calendar supporting the annual business plans, with digital campaigns that are aligned with the overall brand/product campaigns. Plan and monitor the ongoing company presence on social media (LinkedIn, IG, Twitter, Facebook, YouTube etc.) Launch optimized online adverts through Google Adwords, Facebook etc. to increase company and brand awareness. Manage the day-to-day function of digital marketing, including Social Media, Digital Content, Digital Production, website upkeep, and KPI tracking. column2: Calling Content Chameleons! Brands2be Seeks a Social Media Superstar (Min 2 yrs Agency Exp) Do you live and breathe social media?  Can you craft captivating content that makes audiences double-tap faster than a hummingbird? If you're a social media whiz who can transform into the perfect voice for any brand, then we want you at Brands2be! About Brands2be: We're a passionate bunch on a mission to  catapult  brands into the social media stratosphere. We don't just post  we create  laugh-out-loud  moments, spark  engaging  conversations, and build  loyal  brand communities. The Role: As our Social Media Executive, you'll be a  social media shapeshifter , adapting your voice to perfectly represent each brand we work with. You'll be a content creator extraordinaire, a community magnet, and a trend-spotting ninja, all rolled into one. Here's what you'll be doing (besides becoming a social media legend): Crafting engaging content  that gets people talking, sharing, and hitting that like button like it's going out of style. Mastering different social media platforms  (think Facebook fluency, Instagram intimacy, and mastering the art of the Tweet). Scheduling and publishing content  like a social media maestro (keeping our calendar full of engaging awesomeness). Engaging with our communities   responding to comments, fostering conversations, and making our followers feel like part of the fam. Analyzing social media data  to understand what's working and what's not (data is your friend, not your foe!). Staying on top of social media trends   the latest dances, hottest challenges, you name it (because nobody wants to be yesterday's news). Collaborating with the team  to create a cohesive and impactful social media presence (think brainstorming sessions with copious amounts of coffee and laughter). The Ideal Candidate: 2+ years of experience working in a social media agency (you've seen the good, the bad, and the ugly of the social media world). A strong understanding of social media best practices (organic reach? Paid campaigns? You got this!). The ability to create engaging content in various formats (text, images, and even the occasional TikTok masterpiece). Excellent writing and communication skills (because typos are the enemy of social media success). A keen eye for detail (because nobody wants a rogue emoji ruining their post). A passion for social media and all its quirky glory (you get genuinely excited about the latest meme). The ability to work independently and as part of a team (you're a social butterfly with a collaborative spirit). Bonus Points for: Experience working with Brands2be's specific industry (you understand the unique social media challenges of our brand niche). A strong track record of growing brand followings and social media engagement. The ability to think outside the box and come up with creative social media campaigns. Benefits: Be part of a dynamic and growing team (we're not your average stuffy corporate environment). Work on exciting projects that make a real impact (we're passionate about helping brands shine). Enjoy a competitive salary and benefits package (because social media superstars deserve to be rewarded!). Ready to unleash your social media superpowers?  Send your resume and a cover letter that tells us why you're the ultimate content chameleon! We can't wait to meet you.

column2: The Digital Marketing Executive is a key role responsible for planning, implementing, and managing digital marketing campaigns to drive brand awareness, lead generation, and customer engagement. This position requires a strong understanding of digital marketing strategies, platforms, and analytics to optimize online marketing efforts and achieve business objectives Skills & Qualifications: A bachelor's degree in Marketing, Communications, or a related field is preferred. 2+ years of experience in digital marketing, with a proven track record of managing successful digital marketing campaigns across multiple channels. Strong understanding of digital marketing concepts, strategies, and best practices. Familiarity with digital marketing tools and platforms, such as Google Ads, Google Analytics, social media management tools, and email marketing software. Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to create compelling and engaging content for various digital platforms. Proficiency in analysing digital marketing data and using analytics tools to derive insights, measure performance, and optimize campaigns. Ability to think creatively, generate innovative ideas, and adapt to emerging digital marketing trends and technologies. Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple projects, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment. Effective teamwork and collaboration skills to work closely. Responsibilities : Collaborate with the marketing team to develop and execute digital marketing strategies aligned with business goals. Identify target audiences, define campaign objectives, and select appropriate digital channels and tactics. Plan and execute digital marketing campaigns across various channels, such as search engine marketing (SEM), search engine optimization (SEO), social media, email marketing, content marketing, and display advertising. Monitor campaign performance, optimize for maximum results, and drive ROI. Create compelling and engaging content for digital marketing campaigns, including website content, blog articles, social media posts, emails, and advertisements. Ensure content is aligned with brand messaging, optimized for search engines, and tailored for target audiences. Manage social media accounts and develop social media strategies to increase brand awareness, engagement, and lead generation. Create and schedule content, monitor social media metrics, respond to comments and messages, and analyze social media insights to optimize performance. Implement SEO best practices to improve website visibility and organic search rankings. Conduct keyword research, optimize website content, meta tags, and URLs, and monitor SEO performance using analytics tools. Stay updated with SEO trends and algorithm changes. Plan and execute paid advertising campaigns across platforms such as Google Ads, social media advertising, and display networks. Monitor ad performance, optimize targeting and bidding strategies, and manage budgets effectively to maximize ROI. Develop and execute email marketing campaigns to nurture leads, engage customers, and drive conversions.

column2: position Looking for young and dynamic social media executives who will be  responsible for managing, developing, and implementing social media strategies to enhance the online presence and brand awareness of all clients  across various social media platforms. They need to create engaging content, interact with the audience, analyze metrics, and stay updated with the latest trends to optimize their social media presence. Content Creation : Developing engaging content for social media platforms such as Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, LinkedIn, etc. This includes text posts, images, videos, infographics, etc., tailored to each platform's audience and requirements. Social Media Strategy:  Developing and implementing social media strategies to increase brand awareness, and engagement, and drive traffic to the company's website or other platforms. Community Management:  Monitoring and engaging with the audience on social media platforms. Responding to comments, messages, and mentions promptly and professionally. Analytics and Reporting : Tracking key social media metrics such as reach, engagement, click-through rates, and conversions. Analyzing data to gain insights into the effectiveness of social media campaigns and making recommendations for improvements. Social Media Advertising:  Planning and executing paid advertising campaigns on social media platforms. This includes creating ad content, setting targeting parameters, and monitoring campaign performance. Stay Updated with Trends:  Keeping up-to-date with the latest trends, tools, and best practices in social media marketing. Experimenting with new features and technologies to keep the company's social media presence fresh and relevant. Collaboration:  Working closely with other teams such as marketing, PR, customer service, and product development to align social media efforts with overall business goals and strategies. Brand Voice and Identity:  Ensuring consistency in brand voice and identity across all social media channels. Upholding the company's values and maintaining a positive brand image. Crisis Management:  Being prepared to handle any potential social media crises swiftly and effectively. This involves having a crisis communication plan in place and knowing how to respond to negative feedback or PR incidents. Content Calendar Management:  Planning and scheduling social media posts in advance using content calendars. Ensuring a consistent posting schedule to maintain audience engagement and visibility. Influencer Outreach:  Identifying and collaborating with influencers and brand advocates to amplify the company's message and reach a broader audience. SEO Knowledge:  Understanding basic principles of search engine optimization (SEO) to optimize social media content for better visibility and discoverability. Internship opportunities are also available for this postion

column2: Job Title:  Digital Marketing Executive Experience Level:  1-4 yrs Location:  M.G Road, Agra Job Type:  Full-time Job Profile: We are seeking a talented and results-driven Digital Marketing Executive to join our growing team. If you are passionate about digital marketing, have a proven track record of success, and are eager to contribute to the growth of a forward-thinking organization, we want to hear from you. Key Responsibilities: 1. Digital Strategy Development: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop comprehensive digital marketing strategies aligned with business goals. Analyze market trends, competitor activities, and customer behavior to identify opportunities and threats. 2. Social Media Management: Plan and execute engaging social media campaigns across platforms such as Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, LinkedIn, etc. Monitor social media channels for industry trends and engage with the audience to build brand awareness. 3. Content Creation and Management: Develop and curate compelling content for various digital channels, including blogs, website, social media, and email campaigns. Ensure all content is optimized for search engines (SEO) and aligned with brand guidelines. 4. Email Marketing: Create and manage email marketing campaigns, including designing templates, segmenting lists, and analyzing campaign performance. Implement A/B testing to optimize email content and increase open and click-through rates. 5. Paid Advertising: Plan, execute, and optimize paid advertising campaigns on platforms such as Google Ads, Facebook Ads, etc. Manage budget allocation, bid strategy, and targeting to maximize ROI. Qualifications: Bachelors degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field. Proven experience as a Digital Marketing Executive or similar role. In-depth knowledge of digital marketing channels, strategies, and best practices. Hands-on experience with social media, and email marketing. Strong analytical and data-driven mindset with proficiency in analytics tools (Google Analytics, etc.). Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Creative thinker with the ability to generate innovative ideas and solutions. Certifications in digital marketing (e.g., Google Ads, Facebook Blueprint) are a plus.   Key Benefits: Competitive salary commensurate with experience. Health and wellness benefits, including medical coverage. Professional development opportunities and training programs. Collaborative and innovative  work environment. Performance-based bonuses and incentives. Employee recognition programs and team-building activities. Interested candidates may share their resume at  recruitment@oswaalbooks.com / hrlead@oswaalbooks.com

Implementation Focus: Demonstrate a strong commitment to hands-on implementation, ensuring marketing efforts translate into measurable results.     Platform Proficiency: Exhibit a good understanding of key digital platforms, including LinkedIn, YouTube, WordPress, and various paid advertising channels, leveraging these tools to enhance our marketing reach and impact.            Qualifications:         Digital Tool Proficiency: Well-versed in digital marketing tools and platforms, such as Google Analytics, heatmaps, etc. demonstrating the ability to extract and analyze data effectively.       Collaborative Skills: Exceptional ability to work within a team, contributing to a collaborative work environment.     Detail-oriented: Exhibits meticulous attention to detail with the capability to juggle multiple tasks simultaneously without compromising on quality.     SEO and Content Marketing: Has a foundational understanding of SEO principles and content marketing strategies, enhancing content visibility and engagement.     Web Analytics: A good grasp of web analytics. Years of experience: 1-2 good if it's an agency experience.            KPI : All the KPIs should be measured on a monthly frequency.         Website Traffic Growth: Tracks the increase in visitors to the website over time, indicating the success of marketing efforts to attract more audience.       Social Media Follower Increase: Measures brand awareness growth on social platforms by counting new followers.     Increase in ICP connections on linkedin profile, and newsletters: month on month increase in relevant connections and community growth for nurturing new discussions/leads.     Average Session Duration: Measures user engagement by tracking how long visitors stay on your website. Higher durations suggest more compelling content.     Conversion Rate: The percentage of visitors who take a desired action, linking marketing efforts directly to lead generation success.     Lead Generation Volume: Counts the number of new potential customers or inquiries generated, showing the effectiveness of campaigns in attracting interest.

column2: Position Overview: As a Digital Marketing Analyst at Expedite Software Services, you will play a key role in shaping and executing our digital marketing strategies. Additionally, you will serve as a point of contact for public relations and communication initiatives. column2: A Digital Marketing Executive plays a very crucial and specific role as a part of the Digital Marketing & Analytics team.      ?       The job description of a Digital Marketing Executive includes:         Attaining certain and specific goals in generating leads, lead qualification, marketing communication, building brand image and conversion of the leads         Marketing of digital products such as websites and mobile applications in both ways Online and Offline. It includes giving ideas for printed materials such as brochures and posters as well as executing online marketing campaigns         Using Digital Marketing strategies for marketing a product, whether digital or not. This includes online adverts, viral Youtube videos or any online marketing campaign         Monitoring the performance of campaigns and other marketing efforts, evaluating them and taking proper measures to improve the performance.         Responsibilities:           Above was the brief description of what you need to do as a Digital Marketing Executive     But along with this designation, comes certain responsibilities which you need to accept and take over in order to comply with the performance expected from you         Some of these responsibilities are mentioned below:         Planning and execution of marketing projects and campaigns. Ideation and creation of collaterals, distributing them in various media and social platforms and measuring its impact and effectiveness         Performing activities relating to Search Engine Marketing (paid) & Optimization (organic) on a continuous basis         Creating and executing SMS and E-mail based marketing campaigns         Executing Social Media efforts and striving to improve the results in terms of KPIs e.g. likes, shares, tweets, etc         Reviewing and actively managing website and other online assets and sources         Promoting employer s products and/or services in the digital space         Using and researching the internet and new media to reach new customers, generate leads and retain existing customers         Analysing market research and plan promotions, competitions and other various creative marketing techniques based on the research results.         Speaking of skills and qualifications;    good knowledge of internet and marketing is sufficed for this role. A graduate qualifies for this role whereas a higher relevant education and /or experience would be an added advantage.             Desired Candidate Profile         Candidate must have minimum 2 years of relevant experience executing all the digital marketing channels         Ability to work independently on projects and also collaborate as a team member         Candidate must have good English communication skills, both oral and written         Should have worked on Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager and Google webmaster tools         Knowledge of word press or any other CMS         Google certification preferred (analytics & ads)

column1: Urgent Opening For the post of Digital Marketing Executive
column2: Strategy Development : Work with the marketing team to create comprehensive digital marketing strategies aligned with the company's overall objectives. This involves understanding target audiences, market trends, and competitors. Campaign Planning and Execution : Plan and execute digital marketing campaigns across various channels such as email, social media, search engine optimization (SEO), search engine marketing (SEM), content marketing, and display advertising. Content Creation : Develop engaging and relevant content for various digital platforms, including social media posts, blog articles, website content, email newsletters, and promotional materials. Social Media Management : Manage the company's social media accounts, including creating and scheduling posts, engaging with followers, monitoring discussions, and analyzing performance metrics. SEO and SEM : Optimize website content and structure for search engines to improve organic visibility (SEO). Manage paid advertising campaigns on platforms like Google Ads to drive traffic and conversions (SEM). Email Marketing : Create and execute email marketing campaigns, including designing templates, segmenting email lists, writing compelling copy, and analyzing campaign performance. Analytics and Reporting : Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) across all digital marketing channels, analyze data to evaluate campaign effectiveness, and generate regular reports to track progress and inform future strategies. Collaboration : Work closely with other departments such as sales, product development, and customer service to ensure marketing efforts are aligned with overall business goals and provide support as needed. column2: As a Social Media Executive, you will be responsible for developing and implementing social media strategies to increase brand awareness, engagement, and ultimately, drive business growth      You will create and curate content, manage social media campaigns, analyze performance metrics, and interact with the online community to promote our brand effectively          Key Responsibilities:            Content Creation:    Create engaging and relevant content for various social media platforms, including text, images, videos, and infographics.        Social Media Strategy:    Develop and execute social media marketing strategies to meet specific business goals and objectives.        Platform Management:    Manage and maintain the organization s presence on various social media platforms, including but not limited to Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, LinkedIn, and TikTok.        Community Engagement:    Actively engage with the online community by responding to comments, messages, and mentions in a timely and professional manner.        Content Scheduling:    Schedule and publish social media posts at optimal times to maximize reach and engagement.        Campaign Management:    Plan and execute paid social media advertising campaigns, including budget allocation, targeting, and monitoring of ad performance.        Analytics and Reporting:    Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and use data to evaluate the effectiveness of social media efforts. Prepare regular reports to track progress and make data-driven recommendations.        Competitor Analysis:    Stay updated on industry trends and monitor competitors social media activities to identify opportunities and trends.        Social Media Compliance:    Ensure that all social media activities comply with legal and ethical standards, including copyright and data protection regulations.        Collaboration:    Work closely with other departments, such as marketing, sales, and customer support, to align social media strategies with overall business goals.          Qualifications:          Bachelor s degree in marketing, communications, or a related field (preferred).      Proven experience in social media marketing and management.      Familiarity with social media scheduling tools, analytics platforms, and advertising platforms.      Strong creative and writing skills.      Knowledge of SEO and content marketing principles.      Ability to analyze data and draw actionable insights.      Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.      Up-to-date with the latest social media trends and best practices.          Additional Skills:          Graphic design skills (Adobe Photoshop, Canva, etc.) for creating visual content.      Video editing skills (Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, etc.) for creating and editing video content.          Conclusion:            A Social Media Executive plays a pivotal role in shaping an organization s online presence and reputation        They are responsible for creating engaging content, managing social media campaigns, and analyzing data to drive business success through social media marketing      Strong communication, creativity, and analytical skills are essential for success in this role

Email Marketing:                             Executivesdevelop and implement email marketing campaigns to engage with subscribers andnurture leads. column1: Digital & Social Media Associate - Communications and Design
column2: We are seeking a talented and creative communications associate with a strong focus on social media management to join our team.      The ideal candidate will be responsible for developing, maintaining and helping with the execution of social media plans, activities and the calendar.      They must have a keen interest in platforms and other tools which can help enhance our brand s online presence, engage with our target audience, and support our communication goals. An understanding of analytics is essential.              This is a contractual position for an initial term of 11 months, renewable on mutual consent, and with the potential to turn into a regular position over time.            Activities and Tasks        Responsibilities would include, but not be limited to, the following:      Social Media Strategy:        Developing and implementing comprehensive social media plans that align with the organisation s goals and target audiences;      Identifying and staying updated on social media trends, tools, and best practices to drive innovation and improve online engagement;            Content Creation and Curation:        Creating, curating, scheduling and posting engaging content for various social media platforms, including but not limited to Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, LinkedIn, and YouTube;      Maintaining a monthly content calendar for publishing content across IIHS social media handles;      Using tools to automate social media management (like Hootsuite/ Buffer), mailing (like Mailchimp/ SendinBlue/ ActiveCampaign), CRM (like Hubspot) and using content creation tools like Canva;      Having an understanding of and working closely with the design and other teams to develop visually appealing graphics, images, and videos for social media posts;      Collaborating with other teams to gather content and ensure brand consistency across all channels;                Community Engagement:        Actively engaging with the online community, responding to comments, messages, and inquiries, and fostering positive interactions with followers;      Monitoring social media channels for trends and discussions related to the organisation, industry, and relevant topics;            Analytics and Reporting:        Tracking and analysing key performance metrics to measure the effectiveness of social media campaigns and make data-driven improvements;      Preparing regular reports summarising social media activities, growth, and engagement;      Maintaining and updating formats, SOPs, Guides and Checklist for digital media outreach;            Campaign Management:        Assisting with the planning and execution of social media campaigns, including helping with content creation and targeting research for paid promotions in digital media in self-serve ad platforms like Google, Facebook, Instagram, Twitter and LinkedIn;      Monitoring campaign performance and adjusting approaches as needed to optimise results;            Influencer and Partnership Collaboration:        Identifying and collaborating with influencers, partners, and stakeholders to expand the organisation s reach and credibility on social media;            Crisis Management:        Assisting in managing and responding to social media crises or negative comments professionally and efficiently;                Others:        Providing support to other IIHS activities including academics, research, training, practice, operations and others;      Participating in all activities of Institution-Building at IIHS; carrying out tasks as assigned by IIHS; and travelling on IIHS work within the country as and when needed;              Structure and Reporting        The digital & social media associate will be an External Consultant coordinating with the Manager Digital Communications or with any other person designated by the Head - Communications and Design at IIHS, and will be required to collaborate effectively with a diverse group of internal teams and external individuals/organizations, and students.                Person Specification        The ideal candidate should have:        A Bachelor s or Master s degree in Communications, Marketing, or a related field;      3-5 years of relevant work experience;      Proven experience in social media management, with a strong portfolio showcasing successful social media campaigns;      Proficiency in using social media management tools, analytics platforms, and graphic design software;      Excellent written and verbal communication skills;      Strong understanding of branding and the ability to maintain brand consistency across social media platforms;      Creative thinking and the ability to generate innovative content ideas;      An understanding of basic principles of design and design requirements for various types of content, as the candidate will be working closely with the Design Team to create marketing collateral;      Strong organisational and time management skills and attention to detail;      The ability to work independently and as part of a collaborative team;      Knowledge of SEO, SEM, and digital marketing trends; this would be a plus. You will oversee various digital marketing channels and campaigns to achieve business objectives and ensure a strong online presence for the company. Plan and manage online marketing campaigns across various channels, including social media, email marketing, search engine optimization (SEO), pay-per-click (PPC) advertising, and content marketing.                 Create, curate, and optimize content for digital channels to attract and engage the target audience.                 Oversee website development and maintenance to ensure optimal user experience, functionality, and performance.                 Manage and grow the organizations social media presence by creating and sharing content, engaging with the audience, and tracking performance.                 Plan and execute email marketing campaigns, including segmentation, A/B testing, and analytics.                 Optimize website content and structure for search engines (SEO) and manage paid advertising campaigns (SEM) to increase visibility in search results.                 Monitor, analyze, and report on the performance of digital marketing efforts, using tools like Google Analytics and other marketing analytics platforms.                 Develop and manage digital marketing budgets to maximize ROI and achieve set KPIs.                 Manage and handle the internal marketing team along with the cross-functional team communication like content writers, design, and development team.                 Responsible for the task delegation and reporting of assigned juniors to make sure that the team is working on the goals that has been planned and set by the company.
